purpose: Construct the N12_58 projective-clock contextuality hypergraph on 12 projective classes using size-12 missing-triangle orbits as contexts; export incidence, co-occurrence matrix, and bipartite graph; compute invariants.
observations: There are 14 contexts: 10 full contexts containing all 12 classes, and 4 half-sector contexts containing 6 classes.

Class degrees are not uniform: classes in sectors 0 and 1 appear in 13 contexts, sectors 2 and 3 appear in 11 contexts; this reflects the three collapsed contexts restricted to sectors {0,1} and one restricted to {2,3}.
The co-occurrence graph on 12 classes is complete (K12) with three distinct co-occurrence weights (10,11,13) structured by within-sector vs cross-sector relations.
